intro: Pavetta bequaertii, commonly known as the Sierra Pavetta, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. The fruit is a capsule that releases small seeds when mature, aiding in its dispersal.
